I’m the paté on the universal cracker. I’m the grout holding your shower tiles on. I’m out of the saddle, sprinting up that hill and eating glazed donut bracelets off the right arm of Jesus.

Charles Manson.

I don’t know the context of this quote but it was running though my mind as I was climbing a 5km 15% mountain, on my own, at sunset, two thirds of the way though a 235km ride that’s left me suffering two days later.
